intro: Triphyllum platycarpos, commonly known as the broad-fruited Indian plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet being elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring, followed by edible berries that are yellowish-red in color. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, India, and Japan, and thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
